Module Robotinterface
Package robotinterface.trigger

Interface TriggerSystem

All Known Implementing Classes:
TriggerDistributor
public interface TriggerSystem
The Trigger System allows a robot controller to send triggers to another robot controller instance. The controller developer usually will not get into contact with this interface.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void register​(int instanceNumber, TriggerReceiver receiver)
    Register a receiver for triggers, associated with a certain number.
    void sendTrigger​(int fromInstanceNumber, int toInstanceNumber, java.lang.String triggerString)
    Send a trigger to a robot controller.
    void unregister​(int instanceNumber, TriggerReceiver receiver)
    Unregister this receiver from the passed number.

  • Method Details

    • register

      void register​(int instanceNumber, TriggerReceiver receiver)
      Register a receiver for triggers, associated with a certain number. Note that all robot-controllers are automatically registers with their instance number (0...n-1). Any new registration must pass a free number. If the same receiver registeres twice with the same number, the second registration will be ignored without an error.
      Parameters:
      instanceNumber - number to which a sender can send to
      receiver - receiver instance

    • unregister

      void unregister​(int instanceNumber, TriggerReceiver receiver)
      Unregister this receiver from the passed number. This method can be called twice with the same parameters without getting an error.
      Parameters:
      instanceNumber - number under with the instance was registered before
      receiver - receiver instance to unregister

    • sendTrigger

      void sendTrigger​(int fromInstanceNumber, int toInstanceNumber, java.lang.String triggerString)
      Send a trigger to a robot controller. This method usually is not called by the controller developer, instead RobotController.sendTrigger(int, String) should be used.
      Parameters:
      fromInstanceNumber - sender robot controller
      toInstanceNumber - receiver robot controller
      triggerString - the event type – this is any string that only has a meaning for the respective robot controller
